results.title: Director of Product Management
results.description:
Socialive powers remote recording, video production and distribution, transforming enterprise-wide communications. It’s the fastest and most cost-effective way to deliver studio-quality video at scale. Socialive’s cloud video production platform removes the need and complexity of using multiple systems and tools, increasing the ability to easily produce more video featuring global, diverse talent. From beginners to full-fledged video experts, Socialive enables anyone in your organization to easily create on-brand, compliant video with less time and resources. Reduced costs and time savings unlock company-wide use cases that drive increased business value through better, more frequent video communications.

About our Team:
Our company culture is top priority and we strive to create an environment where all of our team members are empowered to do their best work. We’re proud of the collaborative culture we’ve built, even while working fully remote. We also understand that in order to be your best self you need time to relax and recharge. That’s why we encourage everyone at Socialive to take Mental Health Days each month, in addition to their PTO and our company-wide holiday shutdown. As a Built In 2022 Best Remote-First Place To Work winner, we’re growing our diverse, fully remote team with forward-thinking individuals who want to uplevel their careers while contributing to something bigger. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is at the heart of Socialive’s success and we celebrate it in everything we do. Our mission is to be a leader in DEI and demonstrate what it truly means to be a place where all people can be bold and the best version of themselves. 100% Remote role. Socialive is seeking a Director of Product Management to help us expand Socialive’s competitive advantages in the market.



Responsibilities:
  • Work closely with the CTO and engineering leaders to define and communicate the long-term product vision, strategy, and roadmap.
  • Build and own the documentation for upcoming features and projects, detailing the user need, proposed solution, and high-level requirements, while building and refining wireframes to clearly communicate intent and foster collaboration and feedback with stakeholders.
  • Work with the go-to-market, marketing, and sales teams to understand and curate customer requests, and strategize with the engineering team on how to fulfill customer needs.
  • Ensure Socialive’s competitive advantage in the marketplace by identifying competitors, evaluating their strategies, and determining their strengths and weaknesses.
  • Using adaptive leadership skills to collaborate with the appropriate stakeholders per-project, driving forward the definition, scope, and requirements for implementation across multiple engineering teams while working across the company to support successful market delivery.


Experience you’ll ideally bring:
  • 7 or more years of Product experience in a SaaS environment
  • Experience working with enterprise customers as well as direct consumers
  • Experience with video and/or event production platforms is a plus but not required
  • Experience integrating with social media and video distribution platforms is a plus but not required
  • Proficient with product management (e.g. Productboard, Trello), wireframe/design (e.g. Balsamiq, Sketch, Figma), and Atlassian tools (Jira, Confluence)
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Experience driving cross-functional efforts
This position is 100% remote, based in the US.

Compensation: commensurate with experience, $140,000-$170,000 plus equity

results.title: Sr. Product Manager
results.description:
Hive is an email marketing CRM used by brands to personalize and automate their marketing. We pride ourselves on helping brands keep their customers engaged, sell more, and continually improve their marketing.

We integrate with partners like Shopify and Ticketmaster to let brands act on their customer data in real-time, so they can easily segment customers and send perfectly targeted and customized emails & SMS.

We started our company in a University of Waterloo computer lab in early 2014, graduated from Y Combinator that summer (S14 batch) and have been growing ever since. You’ll join our team in Canada (hive.co/careers).

We’re looking for a passionate Product Manager to work alongside our engineering team to ensure we’re making good decisions and building as effectively as possible - while coordinating with other teams at Hive to communicate what/why we’re building (and not building) and the value it will bring to our customers.

You’ll be the first hire on the Product team and will get to dictate the tools we use, the systems we build and the processes that we follow.

What You’ll Do:

  • Own the roadmap - helping us drive as much impact as possible each development cycle, and find a home for valuable ideas that we’re not ready to build yet

  • Talk to customers, understand their problems, and translate these into opportunities for the business

  • Articulate your hypotheses clearly, validate them early and repeatedly, and know when to prototype, gather more data, or start fresh

  • Work with our developers to translate incoming items on the roadmap into clearly specced out tasks to be built

  • Help the team understand why we make the decisions we make, and how the product we ship will impact our customers

  • Work with marketing and CX to drive feature adoption

  • Work with sales and partnerships to ensure we’re leveraging product to drive new business

Who you are:

  • 5 + years of product experience at a software company - bonus points for SaaS or martech experience

  • Strong design skills and familiarity with at least 1 common design tool (we prefer Figma)

  • Familiarity with coding - you don’t need to be a CS major, but you should have a strong enough technical background to navigate your way through the more complex requirements of our product and infrastructure

  • Strong data analytics skills (SQL skills a bonus) and the ability to formulate analyses to answer key product questions

  • An insistence to work in a fast-paced, iterative environment

  • Excellent communication skills, paired with resourcefulness and the ability to act autonomously

  • Business sense - you can constantly spot and contrast various approaches to building the business, and enjoy assessing tradeoffs to make decisions

Bottom line... We're looking for curious, hardworking, down-to-earth people - who are passionate about product.

 

Comp/Benefits Package

  • Meaningful salary and equity: you're rewarded based on impact

  • Work fully remote in Canada: wherever you're happiest & productive

  • Flexible work hours: miminal meetings and no 9-5

  • Health & Dental coverage

  • Unlimited vacation/PTO: so you can be happy and healthy!

  • Comp Range $90-120k per year

     

To learn more about our team check out our About Us page on our website: https://www.hive.co/company

results.title: Technical Product Manager
results.description:
We’re on a mission to help the world’s professionals lead more fulfilling careers - from their first job to their last. At Uvaro, we’ve created a better way to help everyday people launch and grow successful and rewarding careers in tech.
 
Product Managers work with Uvaro’s customers and business teams to identify and realize product opportunities. They are responsible for managing the product definition and roadmap for both software projects internal and external.
 
Technical Product Managers have ownership over the technical backlog and are responsible for translating business requirements into user stories, technical requirements, and acceptance criteria.
 
They are expected to be comfortable clearly communicating and managing these expectations with design and engineering, collaborating with team members, and conducting product reviews.  They will prioritize the technical backlog and work closely with the Scrum Team to build Agile sprints. They are expected to assist market research through methods such as customer interviews, market surveys, and more. They have accountability for coordinating with internal teams to ensure alignment as well as gather suggestions and feedback, and to coordinate development and release plans. 



In this role you’ll:
  • Participate in scrum ceremonies, such as demos, technical refinements, retrospectives, and daily standups in collaboration with team members
  • Conduct discovery activities to validate business cases and requirements
  • Write epics and user stories for UX and engineering teams with clear requirements and acceptance criteria, driven by product needs and vision
  • Conduct product reviews with contributors to ensure product delivery quality
  • Ensure the technical backlog is visible, clear, and prioritized in a way to best achieve company goals
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to bring visibility to engineering timelines and roadmap, and ensure alignment
  • Work alongside the engineering teams to prioritize and plan Agile sprints
  • Communicate sprint goals, timelines, and dependencies
  • Develop and communicate deployment plans in collaboration with devs
  • Assist with coordinating and conducting customer research and validation sessions
 
Don’t worry if you don’t have all the qualifications listed below - we are particularly interested in someone who adapts quickly to change and learns quickly, so if you don’t meet some of the criteria below but think you’re up for the challenge, please still reach out - we’d love to talk to you!



What we’re looking for:
  • Professional product management experience, with a preference for B2C experience
  • Clear interpersonal and communication skills, written and verbal
  • Experience synthesizing product ideas and feedback into actionable product plans and requirements
  • Technical competence with business and roadmapping tools
  • Familiarity with working alongside design and development team members to verify projects are meeting identified criteria
  • A strong sense of initiative and independence
  • Takes pride in their work
  • Remote work experience is a bonus
  • Start-up experience is a bonus
 
The successful candidate is:
  • An effective multitasker
  • Detail-oriented
  • Adaptable and resilient
  • Data-driven
  • A continuous learner
  • Familiar with technical products and development processes
 



In the first six months you’ll:
  • Independently author user stories and acceptance criteria
  • Independently conduct product reviews
  • Have planned two sprints ahead 
  • Managed projects through from ticket creation to deployment
  • Shipped at least one Epic successfully
  • Host demos and answer team questions successfully
  • Participated in user feedback sessions
 
What We’re Offering
 
- Competitive compensation, health benefits, and equity
- Flex work schedule and unlimited vacation policy
- A remote-first work environment, and the opportunity to work with a close-knit, international team
- The opportunity to get in early at a promising startup in the emerging field of tech-enabled education
- A dedicated team with a values-driven culture, with a proven history of investing in individual growth and career development.
- An unprecedented opportunity to grow your network by placing employees at virtually every high-growth tech company in North America
 
If this opportunity excites you, and you believe you’re the right fit, we want to hear from you!
 
At Uvaro, we understand the value of having a diverse and inclusive team. That’s why we believe in providing equal opportunity regardless of race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability, and conviction. Please let us know if you require accommodation during the recruitment process.

results.title: Technical Product manager (f/m/x)
results.description:
We are currently looking for a full-time and experienced Technical Product manager (f/m/x) to strengthen our team. As a technical consultant at our clients, you will be in the front seat to drive the technical strategy and vision of startups and scale-ups and to build their teams from the ground up.

Madewithlove is a remote company from Belgium that helps start- and scale-ups in the tech ecosystem grow. Next to developing high-quality applications, we also shape our clients' teams and the way they work. At madewithlove, you will work on diverse projects for Belgian and international clients in and with hybrid teams.

 

Explore our website to look at who we already worked for and what kind of beautiful and talented people you will be working alongside. Read all about our company culture and what you get in return for all your hard work!

What will you be doing?
  • At the beginning of a project, you observe the client team and their processes, and you get to know the product or service of the client.
  • When the observation is done, you help the management define a technical short- and long-term strategy.
  • You organise the team (Product and/or Engineering), and you assist in hiring, onboarding, evaluating and developing team members throughout the project.
  • You are the final person responsible for all technical issues: architecture, tooling, development processes, documentation, infrastructure, etcetera.

! Don't hesitate to apply if you don't fulfil 100% of the requirements. Superheroes don't exist. People with passion and talent do!

Human skills

  • You protect our company values in and outside the company walls, and you politely speak out when they are not followed. You embrace diversity, inclusivity and (e)quality.

  • You have a passion for SaaS, ranging from start-ups to scale-ups and corporate ventures. You don't mind going the extra mile if needed, and you can manage your own time in a flexible environment.

  • You can develop a technical vision, mission and strategy for the client's product.

  • You can build teams aligned with the company goals by assessing and using people's competencies in the best way.

  • You do what you promise, and you take ownership of tasks. You always try to go for the best quality possible concerning timing and budget.

  • You always aim for quality, so you actively and consistently strive to expand your knowledge, both technical and non-technical. You like sharing your knowledge with colleagues and the world through different channels (blogging, presentations, group discussions, etc.). You are able to give others honest, constructive and actionable feedback. Credit is assigned accurately and generously.

  • You can communicate clearly, taking into account who your audience is. You are always honest, sometimes brutally so, but you are aware of the situation and always stay polite. You know which is the right channel for each message or question. Diplomacy is a crucial element of stakeholder management.

Technical skills

  • You have a thorough knowledge of modern software development, technologies, services and tools.

  • Ideally, you have been developing code yourself, and you know your way around in a codebase.

  • You can evaluate the technical architecture and infrastructure of a platform and make the right technology choices to take it to the next level.

  • You know the best practice development processes and policies and how to implement and maintain them while keeping the company culture in mind.

  • There is no need to be a polyglot, but English is the working language within the company, so we expect a working proficiency.

Bonus points

  • You have something valuable to add when discussing the product, UX and/or UI.

  • Conference stages feel like home to you, and you have been involved in open-source projects, or you organised events/meetups.

Also important

You live and work in the range of time zones UTC-05:00 and UTC+03:00. Since we already have people working in these time zones, stretching it further would make working together no longer efficient, in our opinion. If you are not a Belgian citizen, you will always be hired as an independent subcontractor.

 

What will you be offered?

  • Varied projects in a(n) (inter)national context where you can make a tremendous impact.

  • Remuneration in accordance with the Belgian market.

  • Flexible working conditions tailored to your personal life, giving you a real work-life balance.

  • Twenty-five paid holidays on top of all Belgian national holidays.

  • A yearly company retreat (if Corona leaves us alone).

 
Last but not least: the strengths of a good mix

We specifically encourage underrepresented groups to apply. We believe in the strengths of well-balanced and mixed teams. We hope our applications will attract a broader audience regarding gender, religion, race, age, disability, linguistic differences, socioeconomic status, or sexual orientation. Read more about our efforts towards a more inclusive and diverse environment.

results.title: Product Owner
results.description:
Hi! 👋 Nice to meet you!

To the optimist the glass is half full. To the pessimist the glass is half empty. To the Product Owner the glass is twice as big as it needs to be, which glass are you holding?

If you said twice as big, I suggest you keep reading...☺

Vertrical is an international custom development partner for digital health pioneers with a 100% remote setup. We design and build web & mobile solutions for digital health and pharma scale-ups and enterprises. So we combine health and technology throughout the world, which is pretty cool, right?

If that sounds fun to you, scroll down ⬇️

👉 Your role

As our Product Owner, you will be working with clients and internal stakeholders in order to build a new cloud-native Digital Health product. 

Being an excellent communicator, you ensure mutual understanding between the client stakeholders and our engineering teams and also establish a clear common product vision. Additionally, you identify and communicate roadblocks and risks and update our management team about the project status. 

Collaboration is key in this role as you will be working closely with various departments including engineering, QA, design teams and our product people. You will own the job at hand, this position will require ownership of the product roadmap and making sure it harmonizes well. 

As for your technical and organizational skills, they won't be neglected either. Translating requirements to technical tasks along with arranging meetings with client stakeholders will also be part of your daily doing.

Oh, and before I forget: You will also develop, maintain and prioritize a product backlog. 

👉Here comes the thrilling part

●Digital Health is an exciting and growing industry. You will be part of it, and even better, by supporting us building patient-centric applications, you will also be a part of improving women's health tremendously! 

●Your salary will be between 56-66k GBP per year, depending on your experience.

●Together, we'll strike a balance between platform and integration work: We're building a SaaS platform as our product and at the same time integrate the platform for clients.

●We want you to be able to perform at your best. That's why we give you lots of room to realize your own potential. We are open to creative ideas, implementing best practice's, changing processes, and tools in order to make things work. 

●You will work in a flexible remote-setup. Work-life-balance is important to us and we believe you know best when you are most productive.

👉Our wishes

We hope we already made clear what kind of person we are looking for and what we have to offer. Here's a quick summary of our expectations and if you think you meet a lot of them and you are super keen to work in the digital-health industry, please send us your application:

● You have product knowledge in a software company, ideally in the digital
health sector.

● You speak tech. Your role will require you to translate requirements
to technical tasks and to have a deep understanding of what the engineers want.

● You're a great communicator with strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

● Mentoring and training junior product people should be a natural thing for you as well as guiding and supporting more senior people.

● Ideally, you have a good understanding of an end-to-end customer experience, and you are familiar with web development, interface design concepts and testing concepts.

● The dynamic environment of an international Start-up suits you and you know how to build your own structures

● Remote work is comfortable for you, you're self-organized, reflective, and ask for help proactively when you need it

● If you have heard about HIPPA-compliance or are even certified, that would be awesome.

We know no one can tick all the boxes. It is really important though that this role will be representing Vertrical in front of our clients and managing expectations and project deadlines. Fluent business English and professionalism will be a must.

👉 About working at Vertrical

We all don’t like cheap talk, right? We could try to explain at great length about our really fantastic and talented team, flexible working hours and our outstanding positive company culture. Instead we are open to chat about everything you are interested in with you. Just reach out and we will be happy to get in contact. 🤜🤛

However, what is seriously very important to us and therefore should not go unmentioned:

We're all about building a workplace for the future here at Vertrical, we believe in equality and embrace diversity. We’re an inclusive workplace, where everyone is welcome and be the true and best versions of themselves.

Wow, that was a lot to read. Now that you've made it this far, we would love to see your application.

⚠️ Please note: Due to legal limitations, we can only offer this remote position to someone based in the UK or Germany.

results.title: Director, Product Management - Consumer Products
results.description:
Everly Health's mission is to transform lives with modern, diagnostics-driven care, and we believe that the future of healthcare is meeting people where they are. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, Everly Health is the parent company to Everlywell, Everly Health Solutions, Natalist, and Everly Diagnostics. We've set a new standard of people-focused, diagnostic-driven care that puts patients at the center of their own health journey.
 
Our infrastructure guides the full testing experience with the support of a national clinician network that's composed of hundreds of physicians, nurses, genetic counselors, PharmDs, and member care specialists. Our solutions make world-class virtual care more attainable with rigorous clinical protocols and best-in-class science to tackle some of the healthcare industry's biggest problems.
 
Everly Health is looking for a  Director of Product Management to help drive strategy and execution for Consumer Products, as well as leading and growing a team of product managers. In this role you will build out strategic lines of business, scale existing product lines and make direct topline impact to Everly Health. You will manage, mentor and lead a team of existing product managers and hire to build out the product management organization. As a senior member of the leadership team, you’ll partner closely across design, engineering, marketing, clinical, enterprise, finance, business operations, and other stakeholder teams to develop a deep understanding of our customers and partners, and drive compelling solutions across the company. 
 



What You'll Do:
  • Lead a large team of product managers across all levels and work flawlessly with other leaders for projects with multiple cross functional teams
  • Drive alignment and effective problem resolution across the organization, including marketing, sales, clinical, and the Everly Health  leadership team
  • Leverage market analysis, competitive knowledge, and customer research to define and validate both a project strategy and detailed product plans for your areas of responsibility
  • Expeditiously shepherd the launch of new products by improving the speed and efficiency of product development and clinical processes
  • Work heavily with data to curate ideas and analysis to answer a question and/or build out a revenue impacting business case
  • Define and analyze product metrics to inform decision-making and measure success
  • Develop business models and plans to achieve company OKRs (i.e., revenue growth, user engagement, retention, LTV, etc) 
  • Identify, develop, and lead breakthroughs in playbooks and processes that drive more efficiency, effectiveness, and happiness in how we operate as a product team and engage with other parts of the organization
  • Develop and communicate product requirements as well as a coherent roadmap. Facilitate the same for your teams. Work with product managers, designers, researchers, product marketers and engineers to ensure successful envisioning and delivery of new features and functionality
  • Manage on time delivery of the Consumer Products roadmap 
  • Keep stakeholders informed by regularly sharing progress on existing product initiatives as well as future roadmap plans
  • Recruit / hire, manage, mentor, and grow teams of product managers, collaborating with you on all of the above
  • Remain knowledgeable about the competitive landscape and influence product direction to remain competitive in the market



Who You Are:
  • 9+ years of experience in product management at a top consumer technology company or consumer focused healthcare or health- tech company 
  • 4+ years of direct management experience in growing product teams and career pathing for individuals and managers 
  • MBA or Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Healthcare  or related field or equivalent work experience
  • Strong and focused leader, team player, thought leader  and consensus builder
  • Highly compassionate for customers and team members
  • Management expertise 
  • Ability to drive multiple initiative from concept to execution with perfect go to market execution 
  • Analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Excellent presentation skills 
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Excellent interface skills with Executive Leadership Teams 
  • Ability to work tactically in a fast-paced, start-up-like environment
  • Strong project management and organizational skills, with the ability to work on and manage multiple projects, teams and goals simultaneously
  • Development or design experience is a plus
The base salary range for this role is $159,797 - $177,552 USD. The actual salary offered will be based on the selected candidate's qualifications, market data/ranges, and internal equity. This position is also eligible for a yearly bonus.

· Front Loaded PTO for hourly team members
· Employee discounts

results.title: Director of Product Security
results.description:
Director of Product Security
Summary

The Wikimedia Foundation is looking for a Director of Product Security to help develop, cultivate, and progress the security and privacy of our product services and systems.

The Director of Product Security will join the other Engineering Directors at Wikimedia who lead engineers building and operating features, products, and services used by hundreds of millions of people around the world. This is an opportunity to do good while improving the security, privacy, resilience, scalability, and maintainability of one of the top 15 websites in the world.

You will be leading a team responsible for ensuring and improving the security and integrity of our software systems and technical operations, including open source applications developed in house and off the shelf, with a wide variety of technologies and stack components, hosted in colocated data centers around the world and in the cloud. This position will report to the Vice President of Engineering.

This is a remote position; open to most locations in the world. Some travel required.

You are responsible for:

  • The global product security program, consisting of, but not limited to, the following domains: Application Security Engineering, Threat Intelligence, Vulnerability Management, Security Incident Response, Privacy Engineering, Pen Testing, and Capabilities Management  
  • Providing strategy, leadership, staffing and budgetary requirements across a portfolio of security services in the above domains
  • Ensuring the privacy, security, and integrity of our software products
  • Leading the collaborative creation and maintenance of product and platform security policy
  • Educating staff and volunteer technical contributors in secure software engineering practices 
  • Evaluating current capabilities in conjunction with the Capabilities Management team to ensure effective security controls and countermeasures
  • Managing and developing a team of security professionals by hiring, managing performance, setting individual and team goals, and developing skills and career arcs.
  • Work with cross-functional peer groups such as Enterprise Risk, Legal, IT, Finance, Advancement, Infrastructure Foundations and others in the Foundation to define and execute:
    • Strategies for addressing security and privacy concerns;
    • Initiatives to maintain security as related to software design, development, documentation, and release; and
    • Practices to ensure the privacy, security, and integrity of data throughout the collection, access, analysis, release, and retention processes.
  • Supporting the enterprise risk function in compliance and audit for GDPR, PCI DSS, and other applicable regulations
  • Working closely with the Foundation and our volunteer community to cultivate an affirmative and proactive culture that ensures security and privacy efforts are baked into the ways we share free knowledge with the world
  • Defining and setting priorities and roadmaps for the product security and privacy teams
Skills & Experience:
  • Experience managing, establishing, creating, and deploying security and privacy efforts at a complex organization.
  • CISSP, CEH, GWEB, CASS, and/or CSSLP certification is highly desirable
  • Experience with software product security at a high traffic or high risk internet site is highly desirable
  • 5+ years of progressive management experience
  • 10+ years of applicable security practitioner experience
  • Experience with a broad range of security services and disciplines
  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field or the equivalent in work experience
Qualities that are important to us:
  • Commitment to the mission of the organization, and our values
  • Commitment to our guiding principles
  • Effective at asynchronous communication 
  • Able to navigate and make decisions in circumstances with limited information
  • Solutions focus in a complex environment where resources are limited and our guiding principles are ambitious
  • Curiosity and commitment to continuous learning
  • Ability to grow and learn as a leader while growing and developing others.  
  • Desire to get results through collaboration with others rather than personal technical proficiency. 
  • Emotional intelligence, kindness, and the ability to listen, understand, and respond to multiple perspectives.

Additionally, we would love it if you have:

  • Experience with open source or open knowledge communities
  • Experience as a contributor in the Wikipedia or Wikimedia project communities
About the Wikimedia Foundation

The Wikimedia Foundation is the nonprofit organization that operates Wikipedia and the other Wikimedia free knowledge projects. Our vision is a world in which every single human can freely share in the sum of all knowledge. We believe that everyone has the potential to contribute something to our shared knowledge, and that everyone should be able to access that knowledge freely. We host Wikipedia and the Wikimedia projects, build software experiences for reading, contributing, and sharing Wikimedia content, support the volunteer communities and partners who make Wikimedia possible, and advocate for policies that enable Wikimedia and free knowledge to thrive. 

The Wikimedia Foundation is a charitable, not-for-profit organization that relies on donations. We receive donations from millions of individuals around the world, with an average donation of about $15. We also receive donations through institutional grants and gifts. The Wikimedia Foundation is a United States 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization with offices in San Francisco, California, USA.

As an equal opportunity employer, the Wikimedia Foundation values having a diverse workforce and continuously strives to maintain an inclusive and equitable workplace. We encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. results.title: Associate Product Manager
results.description:
We’re passionate marketers, engineers, and innovators building the technology to power the future of commerce. We’re a B2B SaaS platform helping the world’s most interesting retailers and direct-to-consumer brands remove friction from the customer experience to deliver recurring revenue through subscriptions programs - shifting their consumer interactions from one-and-done transactions to long-lived, highly profitable relationships.

Recent studies show that 75% of direct-to-consumer retailers will offer subscription services by 2023. Ordergroove has created the technology that will allow retailers to do this. 

Want to be a part of it? Keep reading...

Ordergroove is a dynamic, fast-paced environment where you will be involved in building something of real value from the ground-up. We're looking for bright, talented people who are excited about innovation, growth, and the exciting world of Relationship Commerce.  If you’re motivated by a desire to solve problems and deliver groundbreaking insights and solutions you’ll fit in perfectly! We are looking for someone who has worked in the mar-tech ecosystem or subscription-based companies and can bring that expertise to Ordergroove’s client base. 

At Ordergroove, we make product and company decisions based on data. Data is what drives our ability to understand our customers' businesses and their experiences with Ordergroove so we can deliver products and features that truly help them grow. Internally, data empowers cross functional teams to help drive our own success as a company. We are committed to delivering high quality data across all of our platforms and providing key analytic metrics to our external and internal users. 

The data team at Ordergroove encompasses merchant analytics, product analytics, internal analytics and more! We are looking for an Associate Product Manager to join the data team and work across these different areas. Your job will be to make data clear, relevant, easy and accessible to those who need it so that all users, internal and external, can recognize Ordergroove's impact and make impactful decisions. 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Bring data pipelines and products to life, leading initiatives from discovery to launch to understanding outcomes 
  • Own the strategic plan and roadmap for analytics delivered to our merchants 
  • Understand analytics needs and user pain points to craft product vision and solutions to address them. 
  • Determine key initiatives to guide the analytics product forward, break those plans into manageable, measurable, achievable release plans.
  • Work closely with cross functional teams such as engineering, design, success and marketing to understand and shape deliverables around data needs.
  • Identify process gaps and opportunities, take on ever-increasing responsibilities. Communicate your plans and product vision to the company. Work closely with the SVP of Product & Sr Product Manager to build a world-class analytics offering.

ABOUT THE JOB

Our Product team is searching for their future Product Manager. The ideal candidate will value critical thinking and intellectual honesty, and have an insatiable need to continuously improve oneself to learn and navigate new and changing technologies and market opportunities. 

Our Product Managers at Bonfire are “full stack” PMs. You will work closely with our engineering team, designers, and senior management to design solutions, in addition to participating in customer interactions to define needs, test out options, and get feedback for the features you release. You will ensure alignment with our Growth team: Customer Support, Marketing, and Sales.

____________________

Bonfire employees are expected to embrace the Mission and Values, we live together and apart:  Humble Ingenuity, Trusting Partnerships, Inclusive Cooperation, Moral Courage, Healthy Dissatisfaction

____________________

include but are not limited to:

Who are Tyk, and what do we do?

The Tyk API Management platform is helping to drive the connected world and power new products and services. We’re changing the way that organisations connect any number of their systems and services. Whether internal, external, public or highly encrypted systems, Tyk helps businesses drive value across the retail, finance, telecoms, healthcare, or media industries (to name just a few!)

If you’ve banked online, used an app to check the news, or perhaps even driven a connected car, API’s, and by extension, Tyk, make that possible. Founded in 2015 with offices in London - UK, London - Ontario, Atlanta and Singapore, we have many thousands of users of our B2B platform across the globe. Brands using Tyk range from Lotte, Bell, Dominos, Starbucks, to RBS and Societe Generale. We have a varied user base hailing from every continent – even Antarctica.

Our Mission

Tyk is on a mission to connect every system in the world. We’ve started by building an API Management platform.

Total flexibility, default remote, radical responsibility

We offer unlimited paid holidays and remote working from anywhere in the world, for everyone, Why? Tyk was founded on the principle of offering flexibility and autonomy to our employees, we believe this allows our employees to achieve their best results. It also means we can build the best possible team, location and working hours are no barrier.

If this sounds like an environment that you believe could work for you then read on to find out more.

Requirements

The role:

Tyk is one of the leading API management platforms competing on the market with AWS and Google. We are seen as ‘visionaries’ by Gartner and are looking for a snr. product manager to come help shape and bring that vision to life.

Product areas at Tyk are linked to the customer journeys involved in the API management lifecycle, so you’ll need to have a passion for understanding how technical teams work, and care about all interaction points in your product area, such as APIs, CLIs, documentation, GUIs and more.

Our Senior Product Managers at Tyk own their portfolio end to end and have a great level of autonomy in the decisions they take from vision and strategy to the releases and how we should market them.

Senior Product Managers at Tyk will own the direction, strategy and vision of a single product area, from concept through to release. In this outward facing role, you’ll be collaborating with every part of the business, as well as our customers and users, to define and validate your product direction.

Here’s what you’ll be getting up to:

  • Defining and maintaining the strategic roadmap for your product area in line with the wider company, product strategy and market needs
  • Be constantly looking for ways to improve your product area to better suit the needs of our customers and wider market
  • Prioritising themes of work and identifying how we can release value in small increments
  • Provide ongoing communications about your product area to the rest of the organisation and to our customers to build momentum and excitement
  • Communicating the customer and user needs of your product area for your delivery teams as well as the wider organisation
  • Ongoing measuring and reporting of how your product area is performing by means of commercial, marketing and product usage data
  • Empower the delivery teams in your product area to effectively translate your vision into a prioritised release plan - you should not be a bottleneck
  • Develop a deep understanding of your entire product area and become the internal knowledge hub for your product area to make effective decisions and set expectations this should all be clearly documented and available for all to see
  • Helping the commercial team to build effective pricing strategies for your product area

Here’s what we’re looking for:

  • Experience owning the end to end product lifecycle of technical products
  • Effective stakeholder management, negotiation and collaboration skills (both internal and external) - there will be competing priorities that you’ll need to manage
  • Customer centric mindset and data driven approach to product strategy
  • Great communication skills - you will be responsible for pulling together multiple stakeholders with varying needs and expectations, you need to align everyone
  • Clear understanding of how APIs work and the main challenges with managing APIs
  • Product & Systems thinking - Tyk is a complex technical product and you’ll be required to understand the ins and outs of the full user and system lifecycle

Benefits

Here’s why you should join us:

  • Everyone has unlimited paid holidays.
  • We have total flexibility in hours, as we believe creativity flows better when our people are given freedom to decide when they are most productive. Everyone is unique after all.
  • Employee share scheme
  • Generous maternity and paternity leave
  • Company retreats

We all share the same vision - we value authenticity, respect, responsibility, independence, honesty, diversity and inclusion and most importantly treating others how you wish to be treated. We look for like-minded people who bring their personalities to work everyday, strive to achieve their personal goals and who are willing to challenge the way we do things, why? - to make what we do even better!

Our values tell the story of Tyk - here’s how:

  • It’s ok to screw up!

We’ve found that it’s often the ‘stupid’ or unexpected ideas that turn out to be the successful ones - so try it, at least we can say we have!

  • The only stupid idea, is the untested one!

It’s in our DNA - starting a business with founders 12 hours apart, giving our gateway away for free - sure, we did that, and we’d do it again!

  • Trust starts with you - make it count!

Trust is a two-way street - instil it from day one!

  • Assume best intent!

We have each other’s back - we’re all on the same team. Think before you speak or act.

  • Make things better!

Always try to leave things better than when you found them - change is constant, inevitable and embraced! Be that change we want to see.

What’s it like to work here?! check it out: https://tyk.io/worklife/

Tyk is an equal opportunities employer and we are determined to ensure that no applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the grounds of gender, age, disability, religion, belief, sexual orientation, marital status, or race, or is disadvantaged by conditions or requirements which cannot be shown to be justifiable.

You can see more about us here https://tyk.io

results.title: Group Product Manager - Core Experience
results.description:
We Are Redefining How People Approach Their Health
 
ZOE is combining scientific research at a scale never before imagined and cutting-edge AI to improve the health of millions. 
 
Created by the world’s top scientists, our personalised nutrition program is radically reimagining a fundamental human need – eating well for your own body. Currently available in the US, and with a waitlist of more than 250,000 in the UK, ZOE is already helping tens of thousands of ZOE members adopt healthier habits and achieve their goals.
 
We are also the team behind the popular COVID Symptom Study, which played a critical role in the fight against COVID in the UK and has now expanded to become the ZOE Health Study (ZHS). ZHS uses the power of community science to conduct large-scale research from the comfort of contributors’ homes to understand health and prevent disease. Our collective work and expertise in biology, engineering, data science, and nutrition science has led to multiple breakthrough papers in leading scientific journals such as Nature Medicine, Science, The Lancet, and more.
 
A remote-first, well-funded startup, we are backed by founders, investors, and entrepreneurs who have built multi-billion dollar technology companies. We are always looking for innovative thinkers and doers to join our team on a thrilling mission to tackle epic health problems that span the globe. Together, we can improve human health and touch millions of lives.
 
We value inclusivity, transparency, ownership, open-mindedness and diversity. We are passionate about delivering great results and learning in the open. We want our teams to have the freedom to make long-term, high-impact decisions, and the well-being of our teammates and the people around us is a top priority.
 
About the team
 
The Core Experience group owns the member experience from the moment someone hears about ZOE, all the way to their daily interactions with the ZOE app. This translates to a wide remit of responsibility across the funnel; from acquisition and retention all the way to referral. The goal is to help prospects adopt ZOE and make it a core part of their daily lives.
 
The core experience covers everything from the core nutrition programme, the tools we offer our clients to include the ZOE advice in their daily life, personalised recommendations, and integrations (e.g. wearables). The group defines the experience end to end and also works closely with other groups including science & recommendations to provide the most cutting-edge scientific insights and distill the complex calculations we use to produce simple, personalised recommendations which delight our members. 
 
About the role
 
We’re looking for a Group Product Manager to lead the group to help more members achieve their goals by making the ZOE experience the most delightful, easy, and, personalised health experience. You’ll work closely with the VP of Product, Design, and Engineering leads to shape the roadmap across squads, enable fast-paced execution, and drive impact and efficiency as we scale.



You will...
  • Driving world-class execution within your area. Setting the right cadence of delivering value to members, continuously improving the quality of the product, and diminishing risks to ensure high quality. 
  • Going above and beyond to deliver impact for our members. Working within the group, you will be focused on the essence of the problem and doing everything needed to ensure your teams make considerable progress in solving our members’ problems and have a sizeable impact on the organisation. 
  • Setting the success criteria for your Product Group. Ensuring your teams set the right success criteria across the lifecycle of the product is key to moving fast, delivering real value to our members, and setting the right level of ambition. 
  • Identifying, sizing, and prioritising opportunities for the group. You will be diving deep to understand customer problems and provide a robust, data-driven framework for prioritisation to ensure maximum value for our customers. You will also be responsible for pulling the break to “sound-good” ideas and articulating how simple changes lead to a long-term competitive edge. 
  • Inspiring the organisation to think big and grow. You will champion bold ideas and push your team work think big beyond their level of comfort. 
  • Leading to build the organisation and raising the bar: You will be mentoring both your team and the rest of the organization to be customer-centric and thinking big. By connecting the dots you are able to paint a vision of what great looks like and define what the next frontier for the product is.



We think this role would be a great fit if you...
  • Have extensive experience in effectively hiring, managing, and coaching world-class Product teams (preferably in a high-growth environment). 
  • Have been part of a (consumer) business that experienced rapid growth from pre-product-market-fit to Scaling is a strong plus.
  • Are experienced in leading product teams working cross-functionally to deliver end-to-end value in high-risk,  pioneering products.
  • Have a proven track record of being pivotal as an individual contributor in the success of one or more products and businesses. 
  • Have a deep understanding of the interplay between behavioural & cognitive psychology and their role in building habit-forming products. 
  • Have a strong aptitude in quantitative modeling of member behaviour (e.g. viral coefficients, predictive analytics) and championing effectively a culture of data-driven business cases for product teams.
  • Have good expertise in user-centric, rapid product development research methods such as mixed methods user research, product validation, RITE, and other relevant methodologies for sizing and prioritising customer problems. 
  • Have a STEM background and academic and/or professional experience in using big data, machine learning, and AI to deliver customer-facing products and solutions is considered a plus.
  • Are as comfortable getting hands-on as taking a step back and thinking strategically, proactively identifying issues and opportunities, and tackling them without being told to do so. 
  • Have intellectual curiosity & rigour.
Listed above is a snapshot of the experience, skills and attributes we think would come handy for the success in this role. Are you passionate about ZOE and this role but don't tick 100% of the boxes above? Please consider applying anyway. We are happy to up-skill where possible.
 
What you can expect from us
 
Aside from ensuring the industry-benchmark compensation package and providing you with all the hardware and software you need, we have worked hard for our list of benefits to be focused on things that matter to our team members most. 
 
Remote-first - work from home, pop into our London/Boston offices, or work within the EU; you have flexibility to choose your own place of work and work flexibly
Stock options -  we want everyone to be rewarded for contribution to our growth 
Paid time-off - on top of any national / bank holidays, you get 28 days off (25 plus 1 life-event and 2 company-wide reset days) 
Enhanced parental leave - adding on to the statutory offering, we know how important it is to be supportive at times that matter
Private healthcare and life assurance - flexible options to choose what fits 
Health and wellbeing - Employee Assistance Program, Cycle to Work and more 
Pension - paying monthly and offering flexibility to top your pension up 
Allocated social, WFH and Growth (L&D) budgets 
Plenty of learning and social opportunities 
 
We continue to build a benefits package that invests in our team members’ long-term personal and professional growth and wellbeing, adding to this list as it evolves.
 
Equal opportunities
 
We believe that having a truly diverse team where everyone can be their authentic self is the key to our success and we are committed to improving the tech industry for the better. We are passionate about equal opportunities and encourage candidates from any underrepresented backgrounds to apply. We don't discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, marital status, disability or age. When applying, please let us know of any accessibility requirements you may have for your interviews and we will do our best to accommodate.
 
While this position is advertised as full-time, we can be flexible on the specific arrangements and would be happy to discuss part-time, job-share or other flexible arrangements, if required.

results.title: Senior Product Manager
results.description:
The Charts team at BMAT is responsible for the compilation of the official music charts for the recording industry associations in more than 30 countries. We generate these charts from the extensive reports we receive from the most popular online music services in each of the countries in which we operate.

Our mission is to build the most complete and reliable music consumption database for our clients—from record labels to music publishers and music industry associations.

Our focus for the last few years has been on growth with a lean approach, and we’ve successfully built a solid base of customers. As we grow, we continue to build out and formalise our agile product development process, so that we can keep improving our service and scaling our business.

As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for turning our mission into a reality. You will work closely with our clients to understand their needs and transform them into an agile development roadmap and oversee the engineering team in charge of implementing it.

We're looking for someone with a proven track record of owning data-intensive products in agile B2B environments. Previous experience in the music business is a plus. A strong belief that music can save the world is a must.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define the product strategy and roadmap
  • Collect, manage and maintain traceability of requirements from all stakeholders across product releases
  • Set and iterate the team’s internal processes for fulfilling the product roadmap
  • Be the recognized expert in the business on the product, the market, relevant technology and the competition
  • Develop core positioning and messaging for the product

Requirements

  • Minimum of 4 years experience as a Product Manager working on software products in agile environments
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent decision-making, critical thinking and problem solving
  • Technical background, with experience in web-apps
  • Excellent teamwork skills
  • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority
  • Willing to overlap 5h with Barcelona 9-5.
  • Experience in the music industry is a plus

Interview Process

We will start contacting candidates in January.

  • Screening call with HR (30min)
  • Interview with team manager to discuss the project (45min)
  • Take home assignment
  • Final interview (1h)

Benefits

You Can Enjoy
  • Flexible working hours and location
  • Flat hierarchy
  • You can make the role your own and run your own development
  • Online language classes to improve your Spanish, Catalan or English
  • Online and onsite courses and music industry workshops run by inhouse experts
  • We’ll provide you with all equipment needed for you to be comfortable
  • Unlimited time off because we believe that you know best when you need to rest.
  • Barcelona HQ office available to you, kitted out with a rehearsal room https://www.bmat.com/bmat-house/
Who the FAQ are BMAT

BMAT started in 2005 when a group of engineers with a passion for music decided to spin-off from an audio research lab in Barcelona. We’re now over 160 people, spread across Barcelona, Buenos Aires, Lima, Rio de Janeiro, London, Paris, New Jersey, Oslo, LA, Singapore, Tokyo, Manila, Bangkok and Lagos.

We’re a team of pretty decent people who enjoy working with each other. We’re open-minded and well-traveled, coming from all parts of the world. We’ve got rappers, producers, cello players, DJs, and songwriters. The passion for music and the excitement for innovative technology have proven to make a good combination.

We say there’s a BMAT touch. We believe it has to do with being passionate, obsessive, nice, generous, honest, self-motivated, entrepreneurial, intrepid, crazy, extraordinary, creative, agile, human, friendly, smart, witty, talented, naive, optimistic, surprising, sensual, and nerdy, but not very hipster (unfortunately). Our way of being is always sprinkled with transparency, perseverance, flexibility, open-mindedness and trustworthiness.

BMAT has grown as a company of companies. Within BMAT there are a number of products and services that developed semi autonomously for different players – Digital Service Providers, Publishers and Collective Management Organisations.

Diverse perspectives drive innovation, and innovation is kind of our thing. Our open-minded and flexible culture organically fosters this diversity. We've learnt that we thrive on learning from each other, so we don't just welcome but actively hire a range of open-minded people from all walks of life. Our team is made up of people with different backgrounds, perspectives, orientations, abilities, musical tastes, dress sense and time-zones - but we all have one common goal: Making the music world a better place. With equal opportunities for everyone, BMAT is a pretty nice place to work.
